title: Masks, Children and the Summer Heat
sub_head: My heart broke when I saw my 4-year old granddaughter’s class picture.
body:
Regarding Ashley E. McGuire’s “It’s 98 Degrees Out. Why Is My Child Wearing a Mask?” (op-ed, July 10): The other day my heart broke when I saw my 4-year-old granddaughter’s class picture. Not a smile could be seen. She and all her little friends were wearing masks.
Is this really necessary? Long after teachers have been immunized, many schools are still mandating masks in the classroom. Is this about the science or progressive virtue signaling? Why do I feel as if someone from another political party is planting a campaign sign on my lawn?
Jon Fox
Linwood, N.J.
